subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Wood
author: Wiliam Clarke
full_text:
--0-1769345836-1211550633=:92149
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

You started it with your name Frank, and it sounds a little bit better than a ghost box...  "FRANKS BOX ALL OVER YOU TUBE" lol  I seen it, they all turned white and said Radio Shack on them.  I think you should get some kick back from the shack.  Selling all them Radios called Franks Box.

--- On Fri, 5/23/08, purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Wood
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Friday, May 23, 2008, 6:33 AM






Yeah, now they call just about anything that uses a swept radio a 
Frank's Box, but I guess I started it.

Frank-S 

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, Mick <micksghosts@ ...> wrote:
>
> I started doing evp's about a year ago. I use an Olympus digital 
> recorder. I have had some luck. I was given a copy of Gold Wave 
recently 
> and don't know the program yet. I saw that someone offered up a 
link to 
> a free tool but I could only find copies that cost.
> 
> About three weeks ago I had a friend over. He has a pretty 
successful 
> investigative team in my area. One of his members brought 
the 'Franks 
> box' to show me since he knows of my interest in ITC. We didn't use 
it 
> however. They had among other instruments, a K-II emf meter. 
Actually 
> they had about 3 meters of different types. I asked if he could use 
the 
> box but he said he didn't know it well enough yet to label anything 
> paranormal. He did turn it on and there was a lot of noise and 
chatter. 
> They did quit a few videos as well. The results were not that 
favorable 
> with the video but the emf showed allot of activity. We were able 
to 
> 'communicate' using the K-II and asking yes - no questions. I don't 
have 
> the evp's yet. I do have my own evp's from my apartment but not 
from 
> that night. I also have some from a couple cemeteries that I did. I 
like 
> going out by myself which I guess is a big no no in the field of 
> paranormal investigation but it hasn't bothered me much at all.
> 
> I am trying to get his friend to bring the box back over. I became 
> interested in ITC about 11 years ago but never really involved 
myself 
> into it. Someone took a picture of me in my kitchen. When the film 
was 
> developed, a face appeared in the window behind me. There was no 
way a 
> person could have been outside my apartment window. I started doing 
some 
> research on line and that was how I found out about ITC and evp. A 
few 
> years later I saw White Noise and my interest was sparked all over 
> again. I have read about the 'Brown box' and was really excited 
when my 
> buddies friend brought over 'Franks box'. With the popularity of 
all the 
> paranormal shows and groups I have decided to concentrate on evp. I 
am 
> now considered an 'investigator in training' but my interest are 
purely 
> personal.
> 
> I am assuming that you are the 'Frank' of my friends 'Frank's box'. 
I 
> was really surprised at the coincident when I joined this evp group 
to 
> find out that it is your group.
> 
> I hope to learn allot from this group and thanks for having me as a 
member.
> 
> Mick
> 
> PS - I was considering moving to Florida but after reading all 
these 
> 'bog' post, I may move west.
> 
> Frank Sumption wrote:
> 
> > This is one of the wood boxes.
> > 
> > Frank-S
> >
> > ------------ --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- -
------
> > Keep your kids safer online with Windows Live Family Safety. Help 
> > protect your kids. 
> > <http://www.windowsl ive.com/family_ safety/overview. html?
ocid=TXT_TAGLM_ WL_Refresh_ family_safety_ 052008> 
> >
> > 
> > ------------ --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- -
------
> >
> >
> > ------------ --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- -
------
> >
> 
> -- 
> If you have an interest in the paranormal then check out:
> http://www.myspace. com/micksghosts
>
